董事長.definition: chairman of the board of directors

董仲舒.definition: Dong Zhongshu (179-104 BC), philosopher influential in establishing Confucianism as the established system of values of former Han dynasty

董卓.definition: Dong Zhuo (-192), top general of late Han, usurped power in 189, murdered empress dowager and child emperor, killed in 192 by Lü Bu 呂布|吕布

董奉.definition: Dong Feng, doctor during Three Kingdoms period, famous for refusing fees and requesting that his patients plant apricot trees instead

董建華.definition: Tung Chee-hwa (1937-), Hong Kong entrepreneur and politician, chief executive 1997-2005

董必武.definition: Dong Biwu (1886-1975), one of the founders of the Chinese communist party
